## GAD-7 vs RRPSPC

Comparing assessment tools like GAD-7 (Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment) and RRPSPC (Revised Rutter Parent Scale for Preschool Children) can be a tedious task. Without an efficient and precise way of analyzing and comparing these instruments, psychologists may struggle to extract useful insights. This is where the revolutionary software, Harmony, can make a remarkable difference. Designed to harmonise questionnaire items, Harmony simplifies such comparisons, making GAD-7 vs RRPSPC a much more manageable task. Being a time-saving tool for researchers, Harmony uses powerful AI models and natural language processing to compare and harmonise items from different instruments. In the case of GAD-7 vs RRPSPC, the software would provide a percentage match between each item of the two instruments; therefore, aiding researchers in comparing and analyzing data for better research outcomes. Whether the need is to compare English versions of the instruments or ones in different languages, Harmony is up to the task. Utilizing Harmony for the GAD-7 vs RRPSPC comparison can be a game-changer. Navigating the software's web interface at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app is both straightforward and user-friendly. Researchers can either choose instruments from Harmony's database or upload their own instruments in PDF format. The GAD-7 vs RRPSPC comparison need not be a cumbersome process anymore. Give Harmony a try, and experience a streamlined way of harmonising and analyzing your research instruments.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and RRPSPC

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and RRPSPC into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just RRPSPC into Harmony</a> - compare RRPSPC with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
